Posts.Content: Hi Ronstar Thanks for your reply, I will have a look at the link that you sent me. Cheers Dave
Posts.Title: Male breast cancer and tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Hi Leolady Thanks for your reply and the warm welcome as you have probably guessed I am very new at this kind of thing. I have seen the Tamoxifen post and also read quite a bit about it but it seems to me you cant beat talking to the people that really know. Cheers Dave
Posts.Title: Male breast cancer and tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Hi everyone I am a 73 year old male dignosed with breast cancer July 2017, I had a mastectomy and lymph node removal August 2017 followed by radiotherapy in November 2017 I then started on Tamoxifen. I seem to read a lot about long term use of Tamoxifen and depression is depression a normal side effect or am I reading something into this. The only side effect that I have noticed so far is chronic skin itching does anybody know if this is the norm in men or is there anything I can do to relieve this. Cheers in advance Dave
Posts.Title: Male breast cancer and tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Hi Jacmatholmad Yes fatigue does seem to be my main issue the radiotherapy really knocked me up and now with the Tamoxifen I seem to be permantly shattered but hey ho they tell me the cancer is sorted.
Posts.Title: Male breast cancer and tamoxifen
